content.rendered:
Val and Kyle's alternative wedding at The Bell Tower was packed to the brim with super sweet details and a ton of fun.

Jersey girl Val and Floridian Kyle originally met when Kyle's brother introduced them.

Self-proclaimed binge watchers, Kyle later proposed while they were just hangin' out watching La La Land.

"We were eating snacks and then out of nowhere, he pulled out a ring. It was definitely the best surprise!" Val told us.

To kick off the big day, Val and her crew got ready for the first look in plaid flannels with mimosas in hand. While Kyle and the guys hung out outside looking sharp in deep blue suits and burgundy ties.

"Our first look was the best decision," Val told us. "It was a moment for us to see each other before the craziness of the wedding. I was filled with tears but it was my favorite part. I even had my bridesmaids sneak a video from a few yards away as they hid behind a tree!"

Following a sweet and simple ceremony between the windows, guests headed to the bar for cocktail hour.

As guests picked their poison, the wedding party threw on cool leather jackets for some fun photos outside. A policeman even let the couple chill on his bike for a few shots!

Shortly after, guests were seated for a plated dinner with spinach and strawberry salads to begin. Entrees included herb roasted pork loin with balsamic marinated grilled vegetables and roasted corn and charred tomato risotto and honey balsamic chicken with caramelized onion and bacon whipped potatoes. Someone save us a plate?

To wrap up, guests enjoyed a Fox's Donut Den donut cake for dessert and took home custom hangover kits filled with gum, bandaids, Emergen-C, Tylenol, and Alka-Seltzer Plus.

"We knew our friends and family were going to take advantage of the bar," Val told us. "Hey, it's a party and getting married calls for a celebration! Ninety percent of our guests were from out of town so we sent everyone home with a hangover kit - you know, for 'in sickness and in health!'"

Scroll on for more from this fun alternative wedding.

WEDDING DETAILS

Date: March 16, 2019
Bride & Groom: Val and Kyle
Location: The Bell Tower
Guest Count: 122
Colors: Wine & Navy
Photographer: That Wedding Ninja
Paper Goods: Juan D. Sánchez
Florist: Vanida Vongsamphanh
Cake: Fox's Donut Den
Linens: Music City Tents
Entertainment: Sean Kilpatrick & Pure Entertainment USA
Catering & Bar: The Bell Tower
Production Design: Infinity Hospitality
Planning: Emily O. | IH

excerpt.rendered: A fun-filled, non-traditional wedding ceremony & reception at The Bell Tower.
